messages.message: Hey Lydia! Let me add it, but in the meantime running it manually with make build-docker run-docker may work
Aside...I think we really want to get rid of celery-webdriver-tasks, having discussed that multiple times. Is now a good time to do that? cc @Heymian
good question! cc @Hari @Gaurav Saini I thought celery-webdriver-tasks is used for the agent framework?

Fyi.. More context on webdriver removal here:

https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C03F0S3ACQM/p1742315516200249 (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C03F0S3ACQM/p1742315516200249)
JW if we really need chromedriver for that -- is fetching the HTML insufficient? There _are_ a lot of apps out there that are client-side rendered, but I doubt they are that useful for Converse
My gut tells me that a simple GET request would get us 90% of the way to what this feature provides, without the huge security risk that is chromedriver :slightly_smiling_face:
I think all these options were explored, we have to display the content in Converse for which the PDFs are retrieved using chromedriver. cc: @Balaram to provide more details on the implementation!
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OFS364RXhfBBGch7ktWHh6iLN4_FdIrmSMRsebsBor4/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.ehyvqockntl7 - This document captures the different approaches (pros/cons)
